code_systems.title: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine – Clinical Terms (SNOMED CT)
Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC)
Health Level Seven Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, Release 4
Global Alliance for Genomics and Health Phenopackets Schema
Custom Code System RD CDM v2.0.0
International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM)
International Classification of Diseases, Eleventh Revision (ICD-11)
International Organization for Standardization – ISO 3166 Country Codes
International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health (ICF)

data_elements.description: The (local) patient-related identification code.
The date of admission or data capture of the individual.
The individual's date of birth.

data_elements.valueSet: Sex at Birth Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The individual's sex that was assigned at birth.
The chromosomal sex of an individual.
The self-assigned gender of the individual.
The individual's country of birth.
The individual’s general clinical status orvital status.
If deceased, the individual’s date of death.
If deceased, the individual’s primary cause of death.
The individual's age category at thetime of data capture.
The duration of the pregnancy in weeks and days,formatted as XX+X (weeks+days).

data_elements.valueSet: Undiagnosed RD Case Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.recommendedDataSpec_fhir: Code(e.g. ORDO:616874 - Rare disorderwithout a determined diagnosis afterfull investigation)
data_elements.recommendedDataSpec_phenopackets: (OntologyClass (e.g. ORDO:616874 - Rare disorder without a determineddiagnosis after full investigation))
data_elements.description: Identifies cases where an RD diagnosis has notbeen established.
The beginning of an encounter of the individual.
The end of an encounter of the individual.
The status of an encounter of the individual at thetime of data capture.
The class of an encounter of the individualat the time of data capture.

dataSpecification: Ontology Class (MONDO, ORDO, ICD-10, ICD-11, OMIM_g, OMIM_p)
data_elements.description: A disease that the individual was affected by. If agenetic diagnosis or subtypes were diagnosed, please also provide the respective OMIM_g and OMIM_p codes.
The verification status of the disease.

data_elements.valueSet: Age at Onset Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The age at the onset of the first symptomsor signs of the disease.
The date at onset of first symptoms orsigns of the disease.

data_elements.valueSet: Age at Diagnosis Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The individual’s age when the diagnosis was made.
The date on which the disease was determined.
The specific body site affected by disease is encodedusing all descendants of SCT Body Structure (123037004).
The clinical status of the disease indicates whetherit is active, inactive, or resolved.
The severity of the disease is categorised byclinical evaluation.
The genomic diagnoses can correspond to the diagnoseddisease in (5.1) if the same OMIM codes are used.
The interpretation has a ProgressStatus that refers tothe status of the attempted diagnosis.
An enumeration that describes the conclusion made about the genomic interpretation.

data_elements.valueSet: Structural Variant Analysis Method Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The method used to analyse structural variants in the genome.
The reference genome used for analysing the genetic variant.
An unvalidated (HGVS) string that describes the variant change
The specific change in the genomic DNA sequence encoded with a validated g.HGVS expression.
The specific change in the DNA sequence at the nucleotide level with a validated c.HGVS expression.
The specific change in the amino acid sequence resulting from agenetic variant as a validated p.HGVS expression.
The specific gene or genes that were analysed or identified in the study.
The zygosity of the genetic variant.

data_elements.valueSet: Genomic Source Class Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The classification of the genomic source, such as germline, somatic, or other origins.

data_elements.valueSet: DNA Change Type Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The variant’s type of DNA change, such as point mutation, deletion, insertion, or other types.

data_elements.valueSet: Clinical Significance ACMG Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The clinical significance of the genetic variant, indicating its impact on health and disease.
An enumeration flagging the variant as being a candidate for treatment or clinical intervention, which could improve the clinical outcome.

data_elements.valueSet: Clinical Annotation Level Of Evidence Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: The level of evidence supporting the clinical annotation of the genetic variant.
An observed physical and clinical characteristicencoded with HPO.
The current status of the phenotypic feature, indicating whether it is confirmed or refuted.
The date on which the phenotypic feature was observed or recorded. We recommend capturing the time acharacteristic was observed.
Time at which the feature resolved or abated.
Time at which the feature was first observed within  HPO onset categories.
The speed at which disease manifestations appear and develop.
A description of the severity of the feature.

Any number of additional modifiers describing a specific phenotypic feature further, such as severity (HP:0012824), clinical modifiers (HP:0012823), or linking causative infectious agents using the NCBITAXON Ontology.
The evidence for an assertion of the observation of a type defined within the Evidence & Conclusion Ontology (ECO).
A class that describes the assay used to producethe measurement.
The result of the measurement.
The unit of the result's measurement.
The interpretation of the measurement (e.g.: Below/Within/Above age-related reference range, Absent/Low/Normal, or Positive/Negative).
Time at which the measurement was performed.
Clinical procedure performed to acquire the sample used for the measurement.
A unique identifier or local pseudonym for the familymember.

Is the individual the first affected family member who seeks medical attention for a genetic disorder, leading to the diagnosis of other family members. Disclaimer: The SCT code for propositus (64245008) refers to any  gender.

data_elements.elementName: Relationship of the Individual to the Propositus
data_elements.valueSet: Family Relationship To Index Case Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: Specifies the familial relationship of the individual being evaluated to the propositus. Disclaimer: The SNOMEDCT code for propositus (64245008) refers to any gender.
The presence of a biological relationship between parents who are related by blood, typically as first or second cousins.
Specifies the relationship of the selected family member to the patient.
Specifies the record’s status of the family history of a specific family member.
Specifies the sex (or gender) of the specific family member. If possible, the sex assigned at birth should be selected.
Records the current age of the selected family member.
Records the date of birth of the selected family member.
Indicates whether the selected family member is deceased.
Records the cause of death of the selected deceasedfamily member.
Records the age at which the selected family member died.
Indicates whether the selected family member is affected by the same rare disease as the individual.
Indicates the current status of the consent.
Records the date when the consent was given.
References to the policies that are included in thisconsent scope.

data_elements.elementName: Agreement to be Contacted for Research
data_elements.valueSet: Contact for Research Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: Indicates whether the patient agrees to be contacted for research.

data_elements.elementName: Consent to the Reuse of Data
data_elements.valueSet: Data Reuse Consent Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: Indicates whether the patient consents to the reuse of their data.

data_elements.valueSet: Biological Sample Consent Value Set v2.0.0
data_elements.description: Indicates whether a patient's biological sample is available for research.
If there is a biological sample, this data element indicates the link to the biobank of the individual's biological sample.
Specifies the classification of the individualss functioning or disability according to the International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health (ICF).
